title: Weather Update: IMD Issues Heavy Rain Alert For Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra; Hilly States To Witness Snowfall - thedailyjagran.com
article_text:
By Aditya Jha
Thu, 23 Oct 2025 08:08 AM (IST)
Source:JND
Add as a preferred
RELATED ARTICLES

Weather Update: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Wednesday stated that several southern and western states are likely to witness moderate to heavy rainfall for the next few days. The weather department stated that the temperature in the northern states has dipped significantly in the past week. Apart from this, the hilly states are expected to witness snowfall, leading to a dip in the temperature. The continuous rainfall is likely to lead to waterlogging in the key cities, including Chennai and Mumbai, causing inconveniences to the commuters. The IMD has advised the residents to follow the guidelines and limit their outings to avoid any inconveniences.

Southern States To Witness Rain: IMD

While providing details, the weather department stated that several states, including Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Maharashtra, and Telangana, are set to witness moderate to heavy rainfall for the next few days. The coastal regions are also expected to receive thunderstorms and gusty winds, along with heavy rainfall. The continuous rainfall is likely to lead to flood-like situations in the lower regions and traffic disruption in the cities. The weather department has advised the fishermen to follow the guidelines and maintain a distance from the water bodies to avoid inconveniences.

ALSO READ:┬аBihar Weather Today: Major Shift Before Chhath, Temperature Drops In 18 Cities Including Patna

Hilly States To Receive Snowfall

The IMD stated that the hilly states, including Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Jammu and Kashmir, are set to receive snowfall on Thursday. Several key cities, such as Chamba, Kullu, Kinnaur, and Kangra, witnessed rainfall on Wednesday. While providing details, the weather department stated that while Rohtang received six inches of snowfall, the Shinkula, Baralacha, and Kunzum passes received up to 10 inches of snow.

ALSO READ:┬аDelhi Slum Fire: Massive Blaze Guts Shanties In Geeta Colony's Rani Garden; No Casualties Reported

The weather department stated that the northern states, including Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, and Delhi-NCR, are likely to witness a significant dip in temperature in the upcoming days.

title: Karnataka Weather Today: IMD Issues Orange & Yellow Warnings for Heavy Rain, Thunderstorms Across the State - Goodreturns
article_text:
┬а Business
Karnataka Weather Today: IMD Issues Orange & Yellow Warnings for Heavy Rain, Thunderstorms Across the State
By Madhulika Pandey
Updated: Thursday, October 23, 2025, 9:17 [IST]
Share This Article
Add as a preferred source on Google

Karnataka Weather Alert: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange and yellow alerts across several regions of Karnataka from October 23 to 25, warning of heavy to very heavy rainfall, thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds at isolated places. The weather department has cautioned residents, particularly in coastal and southern Karnataka, to stay alert as intense rain and thunderstorm activity are expected in the coming days.

Coastal Karnataka: Orange Alert for October 23

The IMD has placed coastal Karnataka, including the Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts, under an orange alert on October 23, predicting very heavy rain, thundershowers, lightning, and squally winds. This could lead to waterlogging, local flooding, and traffic disruptions in low-lying areas. The region will continue to experience heavy rainfall and thunderstorms under yellow alerts on October 24 and 25, before weather conditions improve from October 26 to 29.

North Interior Karnataka: Yellow Alert for Three Days

For north interior Karnataka, including districts such as Belagavi, Bidar, and Kalaburagi, the IMD has issued yellow alerts from October 23 to 25, forecasting thunderstorms with lightning and winds at isolated places.

South Interior Karnataka: Heavy Rain Likely

In south interior Karnataka, which includes Bengaluru, Mysuru, Chikkamagaluru, and Mandya, the IMD has sounded an orange alert on October 23 for Bengaluru weather, expecting heavy rain and thunderstorm activity, followed by yellow alerts on October 24 and 25. According to the forecast. Bengaluru weather is expected to ease from October 26 to 29, bringing relief from continuous rainfall.

Bengaluru Weather Today

Bengaluru's weather for today, 23 October, is expected to feature a generally cloudy sky with light to moderate rain or thundershowers likely throughout the day. The maximum temperature in the urban region is forecasted to reach 26┬░C, while the minimum will be around 21┬░C. Similar conditions prevail in the rural areas, with temperatures ranging from a maximum of 28┬░C to a minimum of 21┬░C.

Advisory for Residents

With heavy to very heavy rain expected in parts of Karnataka till October 25, residents are advised to stay updated with the latest weather bulletins. The IMD recommends people in vulnerable areas take safety measures and avoid unnecessary travel during periods of intense rainfall. Conditions are likely to improve across the state after October 26, shifting to more stable weather.
